title: 42 years ago, the "Mother of Yoda" conquered Hollywood — then she vanished

title: How to Go From Working in a Steel Mill to Being the Highest Paid Actor on TV
excerpt: Ed O’Neill made his career during the era when networks dominated TV, starring in “Married... With Children” and “Modern Family.” He also gives a stunning performance in the recently released film “The Last Shift,” a new comedy about working-class life. He opens up to Wealthsimple about earning $300 a week in a steel mill in Youngstown and getting a $3-million bonus in Hollywood.

title: The Guy Who Wouldn't Write a Hit: An Interview with David Simon | Claudia Dreifus
excerpt: Claudia Dreifus: You are sometimes called “the Balzac of Baltimore.” What’s your take on the title? David Simon: When people say that, I go, “Did you just call me a ball sac?” I usually goof on that. I haven’t read all of Balzac. I keep slicing up society, taking a different slice each time, thinking, eventually I’ll have a cake. That’s Balzac. That’s what he did. What I never do is raise my hand and say, “This could be a hit. Make this because this could be a hit.” The minute I do that, I’m done as me.

title: The Real-Life Hollywood Hoax That Turned a Fake Bradley Cooper Epic Into a $14 Million Scam
excerpt: Adam Joiner’s silver-screen dreams were finally coming true. He had a deal with Netflix, a superstar lead and even interest from Spielberg. There was only one problem: His entire story was a lie

title: (29) Harry Patch: The Last Tommy - YouTube
excerpt: This truly wonderful film, first broadcast in 2009, examines the life and times of a truly wonderful old gentleman, Britain's last fighting survivor of the Great War, Harry Patch.  Harry died in 2009 at the age of 111 years, one month, one week and one day.  See the excellent Wikipedia article on him and 'Veterans of the Great War', also on my channel.  Uploaded for educational purposes only.
